channel.title: Future of Runescape 2007
channel.description:
I've been thinking about it and playing runescape 2007 can feel like playing a private server. You know all the tips and tricks and nothing really excites you except for that occasion crazy stake/kill.
As long as staking, pking, graphics, and game-changing weapons are left alone I think more updates for 07 would be good.
A few examples would be adding a lot more new unique quests that aren't necessarily tied to EOC. They don't affect you, you can do them if you want, or you can ignore them and pretend they don't exist.
New bosses/PvM are also really important, but Jagex has to be really careful not to create inflation by giving gold drops like old pvp world statues, or
weapons like Dclaws that ruin PvP
New minigames would also be fun, perhaps a PvP type minigame where you can collect drops+get additional points to spend on other crap
tl;dr:
Jagex needs to keep updating the game, constantly adding new content that is [i]optional [/i]

item.title: Future of Runescape 2007
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

March, April?

Look at February compared to last years months…

item.title: Future of Runescape 2007
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:5, topic:527559”]They will release gwd and another hype will explode all over moparscapes face.

Has anyone bothered to see that since old school servers came back we have has a hype of registered users…?

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


No. OSRS came out in February.
February 2013 19,289 34,543 4,962 287
Only 5,000 users registered in February.
July 2013 3,008 18,021 10,276
10,000 users registered in July. RS3 came out in July. February was actually a dip in registration.

Read full topic

item.title: Future of Runescape 2007
item.dc:creator: @OmgItsShane Shane
item.description:
@OmgItsShane wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:2, topic:527559”]Runescape 2007 won’t last another 6 months. I think the reason Jagex held off so long on the “old school Runescape” because they KNEW that the servers wouldn’t last past the initial hype.

Jagex should have recovered everyone’s old accounts from 2007, then people would have kept playing and there wouldn’t have been a big of need to bot. Botting killed this game sadly.

Glad I didn’t waste too much time with this.[/quote]

100% Agree with this unfortunately. Sad to say its true.

Read full topic

item.title: Future of Runescape 2007
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Runescape 2007 won’t last another 6 months. I think the reason Jagex held off so long on the “old school Runescape” because they KNEW that the servers wouldn’t last past the initial hype.

Jagex should have recovered everyone’s old accounts from 2007, then people would have kept playing and there wouldn’t have been a big of need to bot. Botting killed this game sadly.

Glad I didn’t waste too much time with this.

Read full topic
